string.description: name of the AttachmentLookup
the namespace scope in which to operate

Address to perform a lookup for.
This is a standard IPv4 or IPv6 address, excluding mask or prefix length, e.g. 12.0.0.1.

Network Instance is the locally named network instance to use for the lookup.
Can be omitted if the default network instance is to be used.

list.description:
NodeSelectors is a list of node selectors to execute lookups on.
This is a list of label expressions, e.g. ["eda.nokia.com/role=leaf", "eda.nokia.com/region=us-west"].
Nodes is a list of node names to execute lookups on.

single_nested.description:
This workflow is used to look up attachments (where an address is attached in the network) on a set of nodes.
It takes an address, and an optional list of nodes (or node selectors - a list of label expressions) to perform the lookup on,
and returns the matching attachments, including the node,
network instance, prefix, interface, and next hop group ID.
AttachmentLookupStatus defines the observed state of AttachmentLookup

string.description: a comma-separated list of resource fields to fetch/return.  If unspecified, all fields are fetched.  If empty, only key-fields are fetched.
an EQL "where" expression that will be used to filter the set of resources returned.
a label selector string to filter the results based on CR labels
the namespace scope in which to operate

Address to perform a lookup for.

Network Instance is the locally named network instance to use for the lookup.

Nodes is a list of node names to execute lookups on.

resource content will be returned as it was at the time of this git hash
the namespace scope in which to operate

int64.description: The minimum interval in microseconds between transmission of BFD control packets[default=1000000].
The number of packets that must be missed to declare this session as down. [default=3]

bool.description: Enable Biforward Detection[default=false].

int64.description: The minimum interval between echo packets the local node can receive in microseconds
The minimum interval in microseconds between received BFD control packets that this system should support.[default=1000000].
Sets custom IP TTL or Hop Limit for multi-hop BFD sessions packets. Not appllicable to single-hop BFD sessions.

single_nested.description: Enable or disable BFD on this DefaultInterface.

string.description: Reference to a DefaultRouter.
The description of the DefaultInterface.
Reference to an Interface to use for attachment.

int64.description: Set the IP MTU for the DefaultInterface.

string.description: Address and mask to use

bool.description: Indicates which address to use as primary for broadcast

list_nested.description: List of IPv4 addresses in ip/mask form, e.g., 192.168.0.1/24.

string.description: Address and mask to use

bool.description: Indicates which address to use as primary for broadcast

list_nested.description: List of IPv6 addresses in ip/mask form, e.g., fc00::1/120.

string.description: Enables the use of unnumbered interfaces on the ISL. For IPv6, no IP address are configured on the sub-interface and only the link local address will be used. If any allocation pool is specified for IPv6 that will take precedence and IPs will be assigned to the interfaces.  When using eBGP for an underlay protocol, the DefaultInterfaces which are a part of the ISL will be added to the BGP dynamic neighbor list.

int64.description: VLAN to use with this DefaultInterface.

single_nested.description: DefaultInterface enables the configuration of default interfaces, including Interface references, DefaultRouter, VLAN IDs, IP MTU settings, and options for IPv4 and IPv6 addresses. It also supports unnumbered interfaces and BFD (Bidirectional Forwarding Detection) configuration.

int64.description: Indicates the health score of the DefaultInterface.

string.description: Indicates the reason for the health score.
Indicates when this Interface last changed state.
Indicates the current operational state of the DefaultInterface.

string.description: name of the DefaultRouter
resource content will be returned as it was at the time of this git hash
the namespace scope in which to operate

int64.description: Autonomous System number for BGP.
Preference to be set for eBGP.

bool.description: Enables BGP in the default VRF.

int64.description: Preference to be set for iBGP.

bool.description: Enables advertisement of IPv4 Unicast routes with IPv6 next-hops to peers.
Enables the IPv4 unicast AFISAFI.

When set to true, BGP is allowed to build a multipath set using BGP routes with different neighbor AS (most recent AS in the AS_PATH), When set to false, BGP is only allowed to use non-best paths for ECMP if they meet the multipath criteria and they have the same neighbor AS as the best path.

int64.description: The maximum number of BGP ECMP next-hops for BGP routes with an NLRI belonging to the address family of this configuration context.

single_nested.description: Enable multipath.

bool.description: Enables rapid update.
Enables the advertisement of the RFC 5549 capability to receive IPv4 routes with IPv6 next-hops.

single_nested.description: Parameters relating to the IPv4 unicast AFI/SAFI.

bool.description: Enables the IPv6 unicast AFISAFI

When set to true, BGP is allowed to build a multipath set using BGP routes with different neighbor AS (most recent AS in the AS_PATH), When set to false, BGP is only allowed to use non-best paths for ECMP if they meet the multipath criteria and they have the same neighbor AS as the best path.

int64.description: The maximum number of BGP ECMP next-hops for BGP routes with an NLRI belonging to the address family of this configuration context.

single_nested.description: Enable multipath

bool.description: Enables rapid update.

single_nested.description: Parameters relating to the IPv6 unicast AFI/SAFI.

string.description: Keychain to be used for authentication

bool.description: Enables advertisement of EVPN routes with IPv6 next-hops to peers.
Enables the L2VPN EVPN AFISAFI.
Enable inter-AS VPN for EVPN.

When set to true, BGP is allowed to build a multipath set using BGP routes with different neighbor AS (most recent AS in the AS_PATH), When set to false, BGP is only allowed to use non-best paths for ECMP if they meet the multipath criteria and they have the same neighbor AS as the best path.

int64.description: The maximum number of BGP ECMP next-hops for BGP routes with an NLRI belonging to the address family of this configuration context.

single_nested.description: Enable multipath

bool.description: Enables rapid update.

single_nested.description: Parameters relating to the EVPN AFI/SAFI.

int64.description: Minimum wait time before advertising routes post BGP restart.

bool.description: Enable rapid withdrawal in BGP.
When false, all large (12 byte) BGP communities from all outbound routes advertised to the peer are stripped.
When false, all standard (4 byte) communities from all outbound routes advertised to the peer are stripped.
Wait for FIB installation before advertising routes.

single_nested.description: BGP configuration.

string.description: Sets the description on the Default router.

list.description: Reference to a Policy resource to use when evaluating route exports from the DefaultRouter.
Reference to a Policy resource to use when evaluating route imports into the DefaultRouter.

string.description: Reference to a TopoNode on which to configure the default routing instance.

Reference to a Policy resource to use when evaluating route imports into the DefaultRouter.

single_nested.description: Route leaking controlled by routing policies in and out of the DefaultRouter.

string.description: Router ID in dotted quad notation.

single_nested.description: DefaultRouter enables the configuration of default routing instances on a specified Node, including options for BGP configuration, import and export policies, and router IDs.

int64.description: Indicates the health score of the Router.

string.description: Indicates the reason for the health score.
The time when the state of the resource last changed.
Operational state of the Router.
